featured.text: Celebration often begins with mukaebi (welcoming fire), during which people make a small bonfire in front of their house to guide spirits upon their return back home.
But 29 , Rwanda is a symbol of the triumph of the human spirit over evil.
Which of the following sayings best captures the spirit of Jeanie Low’s story? (A) Failure is the mother of success.
We can 30 the spirit going by communicating often and consciously.
Surprisingly, the audience listened with full focus and high spirits.

other.text: Some regions prepare horses made of cucumbers and cows made of eggplants, hoping that the spirits will come back to Earth quickly, on a horse, and leave slowly, riding the cow.

definition.en_def: The non-physical part of a person, often regarded as the true self; also refers to a person's mood or emotional state.
definition.example: She has a lively spirit that brightens everyone's day.
